scenario: You see a shiny object on the kitchen counter that looks like candy, but it’s medicine.
response_guidance: Do not touch or eat anything unless a grown-up gives it to you.
learning_goal: Recognize that not everything that looks like candy is safe.
trusted_action: Ask a parent or elder before touching or eating unknown things.

scenario: You notice the stove glowing red while a parent is cooking.
response_guidance: Stay away from the stove and let adults do the cooking.
learning_goal: Understand that hot surfaces can burn.
trusted_action: Stand back and tell a parent if you need to reach something nearby.

scenario: You see an open plug socket on the wall.
response_guidance: Never put fingers or objects into sockets.
learning_goal: Learn that electricity can hurt you if used wrong.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to use plug covers or fix it.

scenario: You find scissors on the table and want to play with them.
response_guidance: Do not play with scissors or knives.
learning_goal: Understand that sharp tools can cause cuts.
trusted_action: Call an adult to put them away safely.

scenario: You see a bucket of water left in the bathroom.
response_guidance: Do not play near buckets or tubs of water.
learning_goal: Know that even little water can be unsafe without adults.
trusted_action: Tell a parent or older person right away.

scenario: You want to help clean and pick up a spray bottle under the sink.
response_guidance: Do not touch cleaning bottles or sprays.
learning_goal: Understand that cleaning liquids are not safe for children.
trusted_action: Ask a parent before touching cleaning things.

scenario: Someone rings the doorbell while your parents are busy.
response_guidance: Never open the door by yourself.
learning_goal: Learn that only adults should open doors to visitors.
trusted_action: Call your parent or trusted adult to check the door.

scenario: Your toy rolls under a table full of glass items.
response_guidance: Ask an adult for help before reaching in tight or risky spaces.
learning_goal: Understand that glass or heavy things can fall and break.
trusted_action: Wait for adult help to get your toy.

scenario: You spill water on the floor while drinking.
response_guidance: Tell an adult to help clean it up.
learning_goal: Know that slippery floors can cause falls.
trusted_action: Use a towel with an adult’s help to dry it.

scenario: You see a candle burning on the table.
response_guidance: Never touch candles or go near open flames.
learning_goal: Understand that fire can burn and must be handled by adults.
trusted_action: Tell a parent if a candle is left burning.

scenario: You find a button battery on the floor from a toy.
response_guidance: Never put small objects in your mouth.
learning_goal: Learn that small things can get stuck or be harmful.
trusted_action: Show it to an adult immediately.

scenario: You want to climb on a chair to reach a high shelf.
response_guidance: Do not climb furniture or shelves.
learning_goal: Recognize that climbing can lead to falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help reach things that are high up.

scenario: You see a box of matches in a drawer.
response_guidance: Never touch matches or lighters.
learning_goal: Understand that fire-starting tools are not toys.
trusted_action: Tell an adult if you see matches or lighters.

scenario: You take a bath and someone knocks on the door.
response_guidance: Say 'I’m in the bath' and do not open the door.
learning_goal: Understand that bath time is private.
trusted_action: Wait until you are dressed to talk to anyone.

scenario: You hear a strange noise and feel scared.
response_guidance: Go to a trusted adult and tell them how you feel.
learning_goal: Learn to seek help when something feels unsafe.
trusted_action: Stay near trusted adults when you feel afraid.

scenario: You find a pet’s food and think it looks fun to play with.
response_guidance: Do not touch or eat pet food.
learning_goal: Understand that pet food is not for children.
trusted_action: Tell an adult if you spill or touch pet food.

scenario: You see your sibling playing with a plug wire.
response_guidance: Tell them to stop and inform an adult.
learning_goal: Know that wires and plugs are not toys.
trusted_action: Move away and call a parent.

scenario: You notice smoke or smell something burning.
response_guidance: Go to an adult right away, don’t hide.
learning_goal: Understand what to do if there’s smoke or fire.
trusted_action: Find a trusted adult and go outside safely.

scenario: You see a plastic bag on the floor and think it’s fun to play with.
response_guidance: Never put plastic bags near your face.
learning_goal: Know that plastic bags can stop air from coming in.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to put it away safely.

scenario: You are home with your grandparent and the lights go out suddenly.
response_guidance: Stay calm and find your grandparent; do not walk in dark alone.
learning_goal: Learn what to do when lights go out.
trusted_action: Stay close to adults until the lights return.

scenario: You find coins and want to put them in your mouth like pretend food.
response_guidance: Never put small things in your mouth.
learning_goal: Understand that coins and toys can block breathing.
trusted_action: Show the coins to an adult to keep safely.

scenario: You spill milk on the kitchen floor and slip a little.
response_guidance: Call for help and clean it up with an adult.
learning_goal: Recognize that wet floors can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Use a towel carefully with adult help.

scenario: Your little brother is crying and you want to pick him up.
response_guidance: Do not try to lift others by yourself.
learning_goal: Know that lifting can cause falls or hurt both of you.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to help with your brother.

scenario: You notice your toy’s battery cover is loose.
response_guidance: Do not touch the battery or remove it.
learning_goal: Learn that batteries can be dangerous if opened.
trusted_action: Give the toy to an adult to fix safely.

scenario: You see your parent ironing clothes and the iron looks shiny.
response_guidance: Do not touch the iron or ironing board.
learning_goal: Understand that irons are hot and can burn skin.
trusted_action: Stay away until your parent says it’s safe.

scenario: You find a coin stuck in the sofa.
response_guidance: Do not put it in your mouth or play with it.
learning_goal: Know that small items should be handled by adults.
trusted_action: Give the coin to an adult.

scenario: You climb on the bed and jump high for fun.
response_guidance: Do not jump on furniture.
learning_goal: Learn that jumping can cause falls and hurt you.
trusted_action: Play jumping games on soft ground with adults nearby.

scenario: You want to turn on the fan by yourself.
response_guidance: Ask an adult to help with switches.
learning_goal: Learn that electrical switches should be used safely.
trusted_action: Wait for a parent to turn it on for you.

scenario: You find a small marble under the sofa.
response_guidance: Do not put marbles or beads in your mouth.
learning_goal: Understand that round toys can cause choking.
trusted_action: Give it to an adult for safe storage.

scenario: You want to help your parent carry a hot cup of tea.
response_guidance: Never carry hot drinks.
learning_goal: Understand that hot liquids can spill and burn.
trusted_action: Let adults handle hot drinks only.

scenario: You see your cat playing with a string and want to pull it.
response_guidance: Be gentle and do not pull toys from pets.
learning_goal: Learn that sudden movements can scare animals.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help play safely with pets.

scenario: You want to watch cartoons and try to use the remote by yourself.
response_guidance: Ask an adult before turning on the TV.
learning_goal: Know that adults decide what is safe to watch.
trusted_action: Give the remote to a parent first.

scenario: You see a drawer full of shiny kitchen knives.
response_guidance: Do not touch knives or tools.
learning_goal: Recognize that knives can cut and should be used by adults only.
trusted_action: Call a parent if you need to reach something near them.

scenario: You want to help cook by stirring the soup.
response_guidance: Stay back from pots and stoves.
learning_goal: Know that hot food and steam can cause burns.
trusted_action: Help with safe jobs like setting the table instead.

scenario: You spill soap bubbles on the bathroom floor.
response_guidance: Tell an adult and do not run.
learning_goal: Learn that soap makes the floor slippery.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to wipe it safely.

scenario: You find a nail or screw on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not pick it up or play with it.
learning_goal: Understand that small metal items can hurt your skin.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to pick it up safely.

scenario: You see the washing machine door open and want to climb in.
response_guidance: Never climb inside appliances.
learning_goal: Know that washing machines and dryers are not for play.
trusted_action: Close the door and tell an adult.

scenario: You want to touch the fish tank water.
response_guidance: Do not touch pet water or fish tanks.
learning_goal: Learn to keep hands away from pet tanks and cages.
trusted_action: Ask a parent before helping with pets.

scenario: You see wires under the table and think to pull them.
response_guidance: Do not touch or pull wires.
learning_goal: Understand that pulling wires can break things or shock you.
trusted_action: Tell an adult about loose wires.

scenario: You want to sit on a window ledge to look outside.
response_guidance: Never sit or lean on windows.
learning_goal: Learn that windows are not safe to sit near.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to open windows safely.

scenario: You see a glass of water near a computer or phone.
response_guidance: Keep liquids away from electronics.
learning_goal: Know that water and electricity should not mix.
trusted_action: Move the glass or tell an adult.

scenario: You want to taste toothpaste like candy.
response_guidance: Use only a small bit of toothpaste with adult help.
learning_goal: Learn that toothpaste is not for eating.
trusted_action: Brush teeth only when a parent says it’s time.

scenario: You drop a glass cup and it breaks.
response_guidance: Do not try to pick up broken pieces.
learning_goal: Understand that broken glass can cut your skin.
trusted_action: Stay back and call an adult to clean it up.

scenario: You feel upset and want to hide under the bed.
response_guidance: It’s okay to feel sad; find an adult to talk to.
learning_goal: Learn that talking helps you feel safe and calm.
trusted_action: Find a parent or family member to share your feelings.

scenario: You notice someone knocking on the window and you don’t know them.
response_guidance: Do not open or talk through windows to strangers.
learning_goal: Know that strangers should only be handled by adults.
trusted_action: Tell a parent or trusted adult immediately.

scenario: You see your toys scattered on the floor.
response_guidance: Put toys back after playing.
learning_goal: Learn to keep floors clear to avoid falls.
trusted_action: Clean up with a grown-up’s help.

scenario: You are brushing teeth and notice the tap running too long.
response_guidance: Turn off taps after using them.
learning_goal: Learn to save water and prevent spills.
trusted_action: Remind others to turn off taps too.

scenario: You see a medicine bottle on the bedside table.
response_guidance: Never touch or taste medicine without a grown-up.
learning_goal: Understand that only adults give medicine safely.
trusted_action: Tell a parent if you find any medicine.

scenario: You see a small candle on a birthday cake and want to touch the flame.
response_guidance: Do not touch the flame; stay back.
learning_goal: Understand that fire can hurt and must be handled by adults.
trusted_action: Let an adult blow out or handle the candle.

scenario: You want to press buttons on the microwave while it is cooking.
response_guidance: Do not touch buttons or open the microwave while hot.
learning_goal: Learn that hot food and electricity can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help when using kitchen appliances.

scenario: You notice a backpack lying near the stairs and want to step on it.
response_guidance: Do not step on objects on stairs.
learning_goal: Understand that items on stairs can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move it safely.

scenario: You see a plastic container of detergent in the laundry room.
response_guidance: Do not touch or taste detergents.
learning_goal: Learn that cleaning products are not safe for children.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to handle detergents.

scenario: You see a chair near the window and want to climb it to look outside.
response_guidance: Do not climb furniture near windows.
learning_goal: Understand the danger of climbing near open windows.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help you see outside safely.

scenario: You find a leftover nail or screw on the floor in the garage.
response_guidance: Do not touch it.
learning_goal: Learn that sharp metal objects can hurt you.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to pick it up safely.

scenario: You want to open the front door when someone rings the bell.
response_guidance: Do not open the door by yourself.
learning_goal: Learn that adults check who is at the door.
trusted_action: Call a parent or trusted adult to open it.

scenario: You see a bowl of soup left on the coffee table and want to touch it.
response_guidance: Do not touch hot food or drinks.
learning_goal: Recognize that hot liquids can burn skin.
trusted_action: Ask an adult for help if you want some.

scenario: You see a plastic bag on the floor and think it’s fun to play with.
response_guidance: Do not put the bag over your head.
learning_goal: Understand that plastic bags can block breathing.
trusted_action: Give it to an adult to store safely.

scenario: You try to climb onto the countertop to reach cookies.
response_guidance: Do not climb on counters.
learning_goal: Learn that counters are not safe to climb.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to give you the cookies safely.

scenario: You notice a plug point in the bathroom and want to touch it.
response_guidance: Never touch plugs with wet hands.
learning_goal: Learn that water and electricity are dangerous together.
trusted_action: Ask a parent if you need to use electricity.

scenario: You see your sibling crying and want to lift them by yourself.
response_guidance: Do not lift other children alone.
learning_goal: Understand lifting can cause injury.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help with your sibling.

scenario: You see a spilled drink on the floor near the sofa.
response_guidance: Do not run over spills; tell an adult.
learning_goal: Know that wet floors can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to wipe it safely.

scenario: You see a jar of medicine on a high shelf and try to reach it with a chair.
response_guidance: Do not climb to reach medicine.
learning_goal: Learn that medicines are handled only by adults.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to get it safely.

scenario: You see a pet food bowl and want to taste it.
response_guidance: Do not eat pet food.
learning_goal: Understand pet food is not for humans.
trusted_action: Ask an adult if unsure.

scenario: You see a broom or mop handle lying on the floor and want to swing it.
response_guidance: Do not swing or run with household tools.
learning_goal: Learn that handles can hit or trip someone.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to store tools safely.

scenario: You see a small heater plugged in and feel curious to touch it.
response_guidance: Do not touch heaters or hot surfaces.
learning_goal: Learn that heaters can burn your skin.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to turn it on or off safely.

scenario: You want to play with a drawer full of sharp utensils.
response_guidance: Do not touch knives, forks, or scissors.
learning_goal: Understand that sharp utensils can cut.
trusted_action: Tell an adult if you need something from the drawer.

scenario: You notice the bathroom floor is wet and want to run across.
response_guidance: Do not run on wet floors.
learning_goal: Learn that wet floors can make you fall.
trusted_action: Walk carefully and ask an adult to clean it.

scenario: You see a jar of jam on the counter and climb to reach it.
response_guidance: Do not climb counters or furniture.
learning_goal: Understand that climbing can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help you reach items safely.

scenario: You notice a plastic bottle of cleaning spray on a low shelf.
response_guidance: Do not touch or spray chemicals.
learning_goal: Learn that cleaning products are dangerous for children.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to store cleaning items safely.

scenario: You see the window slightly open and want to lean out to see the garden.
response_guidance: Do not lean out of windows.
learning_goal: Understand that windows can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to open windows safely if needed.

scenario: You notice your pet food bowl and want to taste it.
response_guidance: Do not eat pet food.
learning_goal: Learn that pets eat different food than humans.
trusted_action: Ask a parent if unsure about pet food.

scenario: You want to play near the stove while your parent is cooking.
response_guidance: Stay away from hot stoves and ovens.
learning_goal: Learn that cooking areas can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move you to a safe area.

scenario: You notice a chair near the stairs and think to climb on it.
response_guidance: Do not climb on chairs near stairs.
learning_goal: Learn that stairs are dangerous to climb on furniture.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to pick up the chair or supervise play.

scenario: You see a plug with no safety cover and want to touch it.
response_guidance: Do not touch open plugs.
learning_goal: Understand electricity can hurt you.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to cover the plug.

scenario: You find a small marble and want to put it in your mouth.
response_guidance: Do not put small objects in your mouth.
learning_goal: Learn that small toys can block breathing.
trusted_action: Show it to an adult immediately.

scenario: You see a candle on a table and want to blow it out yourself.
response_guidance: Do not touch or blow out candles without an adult.
learning_goal: Understand that fire can burn and needs adult supervision.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to help with candles.

scenario: You try to pull on the curtains to climb the window sill.
response_guidance: Do not climb using curtains or blinds.
learning_goal: Learn that windows are dangerous to climb.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to open windows safely.

scenario: You see a bottle of mouthwash and want to taste it.
response_guidance: Do not drink mouthwash.
learning_goal: Learn that adult liquids are not for children.
trusted_action: Ask a parent if you are curious.

scenario: You want to swing a broom or mop around while cleaning.
response_guidance: Do not swing or run with cleaning tools.
learning_goal: Learn that tools can hurt someone if swung.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to show safe ways to help with cleaning.

scenario: You see a glass of juice on the edge of the table and want to grab it.
response_guidance: Do not reach for drinks on the table edge.
learning_goal: Learn that objects can fall and spill hot or cold liquids.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move the drink closer safely.

scenario: You notice a small stool near the window and think to climb it.
response_guidance: Do not climb near windows.
learning_goal: Understand that climbing can be dangerous near heights.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help you see outside safely.

scenario: You want to play with a drawer full of scissors, knives, and other sharp tools.
response_guidance: Do not touch sharp objects.
learning_goal: Learn that sharp objects can cut and are for adults only.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to give you safe tools for play.

scenario: You see a small plug exposed on the wall and want to touch it.
response_guidance: Do not touch plugs or electrical outlets.
learning_goal: Understand electricity can hurt or shock you.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately about exposed plugs.

scenario: You notice a pile of toys near the doorway and think to run across.
response_guidance: Do not run through cluttered areas.
learning_goal: Learn that toys on the floor can make you fall.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help clear the path.

scenario: You see a candle burning on the table and want to blow it out yourself.
response_guidance: Do not touch or blow out candles without an adult.
learning_goal: Understand that fire can burn and needs supervision.
trusted_action: Ask a parent to help with candles.

scenario: You try to climb on a kitchen counter to reach a cookie jar.
response_guidance: Do not climb counters.
learning_goal: Learn that counters are unsafe to climb.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to get cookies for you safely.

scenario: You see a bottle of mouthwash and want to taste it.
response_guidance: Do not drink mouthwash.
learning_goal: Learn that adult liquids are not safe for children.
trusted_action: Ask a parent if curious.

scenario: You see your pet bowl and want to taste the pet food.
response_guidance: Do not eat pet food.
learning_goal: Learn that pets eat different food than humans.
trusted_action: Ask a parent if unsure.

scenario: You notice a wet floor in the bathroom and want to run across.
response_guidance: Do not run on wet floors.
learning_goal: Learn that wet floors can make you fall.
trusted_action: Walk carefully and tell an adult.

scenario: You want to climb on a chair to reach a high shelf.
response_guidance: Do not climb on chairs or furniture.
learning_goal: Understand that climbing can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to reach it safely.

scenario: You see a small pill on the floor and want to pick it up.
response_guidance: Do not touch medicines.
learning_goal: Learn that medicines are for adults only.
trusted_action: Tell a parent immediately.

scenario: You see a broom handle on the floor and want to swing it.
response_guidance: Do not swing cleaning tools.
learning_goal: Learn that swinging tools can hurt yourself or others.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to show safe ways to help with cleaning.

scenario: You notice a jar of hot soup left on the counter.
response_guidance: Do not touch hot food.
learning_goal: Learn that hot items can burn.
trusted_action: Ask an adult before touching any hot food.

scenario: You see a power cord lying across the floor and think to step over it.
response_guidance: Do not step on cords or wires.
learning_goal: Learn that wires can be dangerous and cause trips or shocks.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to move the cord safely.

scenario: You see a drawer of matches and want to play with them.
response_guidance: Do not touch matches or lighters.
learning_goal: Learn that fire-starting objects are dangerous for children.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately.

scenario: You notice a stack of books on the floor and think to climb over them.
response_guidance: Do not climb over piles of books or objects.
learning_goal: Understand that obstacles can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clear the books safely.

scenario: You see a glass bottle on the counter and want to grab it.
response_guidance: Do not touch glass bottles alone.
learning_goal: Learn that glass can break and hurt you.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to handle glass items.

scenario: You notice the washing machine lid is open and want to put your hand inside.
response_guidance: Do not put hands inside machines.
learning_goal: Learn that machines can hurt hands.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help with laundry.

scenario: You want to climb on a table to reach a toy.
response_guidance: Do not climb on tables.
learning_goal: Learn that climbing on furniture can cause injuries.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to reach the toy safely.

scenario: You see a cord hanging from the blinds and want to pull it.
response_guidance: Do not pull or play with cords.
learning_goal: Learn that hanging cords can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Tell an adult about the cord.

scenario: You notice a pile of laundry on the floor and want to jump on it.
response_guidance: Do not jump on piles of laundry.
learning_goal: Learn that slippery or uneven surfaces can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help pick up laundry.

scenario: You see a jar of peanut butter on a high shelf and want to climb to reach it.
response_guidance: Do not climb to reach food items.
learning_goal: Understand that high places can be unsafe to climb.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to get the item for you.

scenario: You see a small bottle of hand sanitizer and want to drink it.
response_guidance: Do not drink sanitizers.
learning_goal: Learn that sanitizers are not safe to consume.
trusted_action: Tell an adult if you are curious.

scenario: You want to open the front door when the doorbell rings.
response_guidance: Do not open doors without an adult.
learning_goal: Learn that only adults should answer the door.
trusted_action: Call a parent or trusted adult to open the door.

scenario: You see a small coin on the floor and want to put it in your mouth.
response_guidance: Do not put small objects in your mouth.
learning_goal: Learn that small items can block breathing.
trusted_action: Give it to an adult immediately.

scenario: You notice a hot iron on the table and want to touch it.
response_guidance: Do not touch hot appliances.
learning_goal: Learn that irons can burn and should be handled by adults.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move the iron safely.

scenario: You see a spoon in the soup and want to grab it quickly.
response_guidance: Do not grab utensils in hot food.
learning_goal: Learn that hot food and utensils can burn skin.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help serve food safely.

scenario: You see a hot kettle on the stove and a chair nearby that you want to climb to reach it.
response_guidance: Do not climb or touch the kettle.
learning_goal: Understand that hot objects and climbing furniture are dangerous together.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to handle the kettle safely.

scenario: You see a power strip with multiple plugs and a small toy on the floor near it.
response_guidance: Do not touch the power strip or step on toys near cords.
learning_goal: Learn that cords and toys together can cause shocks or trips.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to organize the cords safely.

scenario: You see a candle on the table and a cat nearby that might knock it over.
response_guidance: Do not touch the candle or play near it.
learning_goal: Understand that pets and fire can be dangerous together.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move the candle or pet safely.

scenario: You see a wet bathroom floor and a plugged-in hairdryer nearby.
response_guidance: Do not touch the hairdryer or run on wet floors.
learning_goal: Learn that water and electricity together are dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move electrical items safely.

scenario: You notice a cupboard with cleaning liquids and a small chair near it.
response_guidance: Do not climb to reach cleaning liquids.
learning_goal: Understand that chemicals and climbing furniture together are dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to get items safely.

scenario: You see a toaster plugged in and crumbs on the counter that you want to pick up.
response_guidance: Do not touch the toaster or hot surfaces.
learning_goal: Learn that electricity and heat can be dangerous together.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clean and handle the toaster safely.

scenario: You see a small object on the stairs and a ball rolling nearby.
response_guidance: Do not run or pick up objects alone on stairs.
learning_goal: Understand that multiple obstacles increase risk of falling.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clear the stairs safely.

scenario: You notice a window slightly open with a chair near it and toys on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not climb or lean near the window.
learning_goal: Learn that obstacles near windows can be dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to make the area safe.

scenario: You see a candle and a bottle of alcohol nearby.
response_guidance: Do not touch either item.
learning_goal: Learn that fire and chemicals together are very dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to handle both safely.

scenario: You notice a small chair near a plugged-in fan and toys around it.
response_guidance: Do not climb on the chair near the fan.
learning_goal: Understand that furniture and electrical items together increase danger.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to organize the area safely.

scenario: You see a basket of laundry near the stairs and want to climb to reach it.
response_guidance: Do not climb stairs with objects around.
learning_goal: Learn that climbing near obstacles can be risky.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move items safely.

scenario: You see a glass of water on the edge of a counter near a plugged-in toaster.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move items near electricity.
learning_goal: Learn that liquids near electricity are dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move items safely.

scenario: You notice a candle on the table, a pet nearby, and a toy on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not touch or play near the candle.
learning_goal: Learn that multiple risks together are more dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to make the area safe.

scenario: You see a chair near a stove and a hot pan on it.
response_guidance: Do not climb near the stove.
learning_goal: Understand that climbing near hot surfaces is dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move the pan safely.

scenario: You see a bottle of detergent near a sink with water spilled around.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move detergent alone.
learning_goal: Learn that chemicals and slippery surfaces together are dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clean and store items safely.

scenario: You see a chair near a heater and a small toy on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not climb or play near the heater.
learning_goal: Understand that hot appliances and obstacles together increase risk.

learning_goal: Recognize that wet floors can cause accidents.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to pick it up.

scenario: You notice a chair tipped backward near a table.
response_guidance: Do not sit or climb on it.
learning_goal: Recognize unstable furniture can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to stabilize it.

scenario: You notice a jar of coins near the edge of a table.
response_guidance: Do not touch or play with them.
learning_goal: Understand small objects can cause choking or trips.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to pick them up safely.

scenario: You see a hot kettle left on the stove.
response_guidance: Do not touch it.
learning_goal: Understand the dangers of hot liquids and steam.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to handle it safely.

scenario: You notice a stack of magazines on the stairs.
response_guidance: Do not run or walk over them.
learning_goal: Recognize that objects on stairs can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to remove them.

scenario: You notice a pile of clothes blocking the hallway.
response_guidance: Do not run past them.
learning_goal: Understand that clutter can cause trips and falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move them.

scenario: You notice a chair near the window with a loose cushion.
response_guidance: Do not climb on it.
learning_goal: Understand unstable furniture near windows is dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to stabilize the chair.

scenario: You notice a spilled bottle of juice on the kitchen floor.
response_guidance: Do not walk on it.
learning_goal: Recognize slippery surfaces can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clean it up.

scenario: You notice a toaster plugged in with bread inside.
response_guidance: Do not touch or operate it alone.
learning_goal: Understand electrical appliances need supervision.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to handle it safely.

scenario: You notice a cabinet with cleaning chemicals left open.
response_guidance: Do not touch or open them.
learning_goal: Recognize household chemicals can be harmful.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to close and secure them.

scenario: You notice an iron left plugged in and hot on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not touch it.
learning_goal: Understand hot appliances are dangerous.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to unplug and move it safely.

scenario: You see a wet mop left in the hallway.
response_guidance: Do not walk on it.
learning_goal: Recognize water on the floor can cause accidents.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to remove it.

scenario: You notice a stove with a pot of boiling water unattended.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move it.
learning_goal: Understand hot liquids can cause burns.
trusted_action: Alert an adult immediately.

scenario: You see a fan spinning near a low table with toys.
response_guidance: Do not touch or throw objects near it.
learning_goal: Recognize moving parts can cause injuries.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to adjust the fan or move objects.

scenario: You notice a stack of books near the edge of a table.
response_guidance: Do not touch or pull them.
learning_goal: Understand objects can fall and hurt someone.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move them safely.

scenario: You see a wet towel draped over a chair.
response_guidance: Do not touch or walk near it.
learning_goal: Recognize that wet items can make surfaces slippery.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to remove it safely.

scenario: You notice a chair placed under a shelf with heavy objects.
response_guidance: Do not climb on it.
learning_goal: Recognize objects can fall from height.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to retrieve objects safely.

scenario: You notice a low cabinet with cleaning chemicals inside.
response_guidance: Do not open or touch them.
learning_goal: Understand chemicals can be harmful.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to secure them.

scenario: You notice a small rug near the door bunched up.
response_guidance: Do not step on it.
learning_goal: Recognize uneven surfaces can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to fix the rug.

scenario: You notice a small stool left in the middle of a hallway.
response_guidance: Do not step over it.
learning_goal: Understand obstacles can cause falls.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move it.

scenario: You notice a jar of coins on a low shelf near your reach.
response_guidance: Do not touch or play with them.
learning_goal: Recognize small objects can cause choking or trips.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to secure them.

scenario: You see smoke coming from the toaster in the kitchen.
response_guidance: Do not touch the toaster or try to put it out yourself.
learning_goal: Understand the importance of alerting an adult during smoke or fire.
trusted_action: Alert an adult immediately and stay back.

scenario: You smell gas in the kitchen when no one is cooking.
response_guidance: Do not turn on lights or use matches.
learning_goal: Recognize the smell of gas as a danger sign.
trusted_action: Leave the area and tell an adult immediately.

scenario: The power suddenly goes out while you are watching TV.
response_guidance: Do not panic or try to fix it.
learning_goal: Learn to stay calm during unexpected events.
trusted_action: Stay still and call for an adult.

scenario: You see a spark near an electrical outlet.
response_guidance: Do not touch or plug anything in.
learning_goal: Recognize electrical hazards and know to stay away.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately.

scenario: You accidentally spill water near a power cord.
response_guidance: Do not touch the cord or the water.
learning_goal: Understand that water conducts electricity.
trusted_action: Move away and tell an adult.

scenario: You see a candle burning near paper decorations.
response_guidance: Do not touch or blow on it.
learning_goal: Recognize that flames can spread quickly.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move or extinguish it safely.

scenario: The smoke alarm starts beeping loudly.
response_guidance: Do not hide or cover your ears.
learning_goal: Learn to follow safety instructions during alarms.
trusted_action: Go to your safe spot or find an adult immediately.

scenario: You accidentally drop and break a glass cup.
response_guidance: Do not try to pick up the pieces.
learning_goal: Understand sharp objects can hurt you.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to clean it up safely.

scenario: You smell something burning in another room.
response_guidance: Do not go looking for the source.
learning_goal: Recognize when to alert an adult and stay safe.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away.

scenario: You see a plug hanging halfway out of an outlet.
response_guidance: Do not touch or push it in.
learning_goal: Understand outlets are not safe to handle.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to fix it.

scenario: You see a pile of laundry blocking the heater vent.
response_guidance: Do not move it yourself.
learning_goal: Learn that vents must stay clear to prevent overheating.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to clear it safely.

scenario: You find your pet chewing on an electric wire.
response_guidance: Do not pull the wire or touch the pet.
learning_goal: Recognize pets can cause accidents too.
trusted_action: Call an adult immediately.

scenario: You find a box of matches left on the table.
response_guidance: Do not play with or touch them.
learning_goal: Learn that matches are for adults only.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away.

scenario: You accidentally drop water near an extension cord.
response_guidance: Do not step in or touch the cord.
learning_goal: Recognize the risk of electricity and water together.
trusted_action: Back away and tell an adult.

scenario: You are home alone for a short time and the doorbell rings.
response_guidance: Do not open the door or tell the person you are alone.
learning_goal: Understand how to stay safe when someone unknown comes to the door.
trusted_action: Look through the peephole, ignore the doorbell, and call a trusted adult.

scenario: You hear strange noises at night when your parents are asleep.
response_guidance: Do not leave your room alone to investigate.
learning_goal: Learn to respond calmly to unusual sounds.
trusted_action: Call for your parents or an adult family member.

scenario: You accidentally lock yourself inside a bathroom.
response_guidance: Do not panic or try to force the door open.
learning_goal: Understand calm problem-solving during small emergencies.
trusted_action: Call out for help and wait for an adult.

scenario: The phone rings and the caller asks if your parents are home.
response_guidance: Do not tell strangers that adults are not home.
learning_goal: Recognize phone safety and privacy rules.
trusted_action: Say your parents are busy and take a message.

scenario: You are using scissors for a craft project.
response_guidance: Always cut away from your body and never run with scissors.
learning_goal: Learn proper handling of sharp tools.
trusted_action: Use scissors only while sitting and under supervision.

scenario: You spill juice on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not leave it for later or walk on it.
learning_goal: Understand that spills can cause falls.
trusted_action: Wipe it up with a towel or ask an adult for help.

scenario: You find cleaning liquids under the sink.
response_guidance: Do not open or smell the bottles.
learning_goal: Recognize that cleaning products can be poisonous.
trusted_action: Close the cabinet and tell an adult.

scenario: You want to make popcorn using the microwave.
response_guidance: Do not use appliances without permission.
learning_goal: Understand that some kitchen tasks need supervision.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to help you use the microwave safely.

scenario: You see a puddle near the refrigerator.
response_guidance: Do not touch the puddle or the plug.
learning_goal: Recognize the risks of mixing electricity and water.
trusted_action: Call an adult to clean and inspect it safely.

scenario: Your sibling gets a small cut while playing.
response_guidance: Do not touch the wound with your hands.
learning_goal: Understand basic first aid awareness.
trusted_action: Tell an adult and get a clean tissue or bandage ready.

scenario: You find a broken light bulb on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not pick up broken pieces with your hands.
learning_goal: Understand that glass can cause injuries.
trusted_action: Call an adult to clean it safely with a broom.

scenario: The stove is still hot after cooking.
response_guidance: Do not touch the stove even if it looks cool.
learning_goal: Recognize that heat remains after cooking.
trusted_action: Stay away and remind others it is still hot.

scenario: You see your younger sibling near the balcony railing.
response_guidance: Do not climb or lean over the railing.
learning_goal: Learn how to prevent falls from heights.
trusted_action: Hold your sibling’s hand and call an adult.

scenario: You notice your toys are scattered near the stairs.
response_guidance: Do not leave toys on walkways or stairs.
learning_goal: Understand how clutter can cause accidents.
trusted_action: Pick them up or ask for help cleaning the area.

scenario: You see sparks when plugging in your night lamp.
response_guidance: Unplug it only if it’s safe or call an adult.
learning_goal: Recognize electrical hazards.
trusted_action: Turn off the switch and tell an adult right away.

scenario: The floor feels slippery after someone mopped it.
response_guidance: Do not run or play on wet floors.
learning_goal: Recognize the risk of slipping and falling.
trusted_action: Walk carefully or wait until it’s dry.

scenario: You see a bottle labeled with a skull symbol.
response_guidance: Do not touch or open it.
learning_goal: Recognize danger symbols on household items.
trusted_action: Tell an adult where you found it.

scenario: You smell something strange from the laundry room.
response_guidance: Do not enter the room or touch anything.
learning_goal: Understand that strong smells can mean chemicals are unsafe.
trusted_action: Call an adult immediately.

scenario: You hear a fire alarm while taking a bath.
response_guidance: Get out carefully and wrap yourself in a towel.
learning_goal: Respond quickly and safely during emergencies.
trusted_action: Leave the bathroom and go to your safe meeting spot with an adult.

scenario: You see your sibling trying to plug too many things into one socket.
response_guidance: Do not touch the plugs or cords.
learning_goal: Understand that overloading sockets can cause fires.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away to fix it.

scenario: You notice a wet towel on the heater.
response_guidance: Do not try to move it if the heater is hot.
learning_goal: Recognize that hot appliances can cause burns or fires.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to remove it safely.

scenario: You spill cooking oil on the kitchen floor.
response_guidance: Do not try to clean it without help.
learning_goal: Understand that oil can cause slips and is flammable.
trusted_action: Call an adult to clean it safely.

scenario: You find a candle still burning before bedtime.
response_guidance: Do not blow it out yourself if it’s in a high place.
learning_goal: Recognize unattended flames as dangerous.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to put it out safely.

scenario: You see a small insect spray bottle on the dining table.
response_guidance: Do not play with or smell sprays.
learning_goal: Recognize that insect sprays are toxic.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to put it away safely.

scenario: You are asked to help test the smoke alarm.
response_guidance: Cover your ears and listen for how it sounds.
learning_goal: Familiarize with the sound of safety alarms.
trusted_action: Ask an adult questions about what to do if it rings for real.

scenario: You see smoke coming from a garbage bin.
response_guidance: Do not pour water or touch the bin.
learning_goal: Recognize small fires as emergencies.
trusted_action: Alert an adult immediately and move away.

scenario: The ceiling fan starts wobbling and making noise.
response_guidance: Do not stand under it or turn it off yourself.
learning_goal: Recognize malfunctioning appliances as unsafe.
trusted_action: Call an adult to check it safely.

scenario: You drop your toy in the washing machine.
response_guidance: Do not reach inside or press buttons.
learning_goal: Understand machines can start moving suddenly.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to help retrieve it safely.

scenario: The water in the tap suddenly becomes very hot.
response_guidance: Do not touch or test it again.
learning_goal: Learn to prevent burns from hot water.
trusted_action: Turn the tap off and inform an adult.

scenario: You smell something strange from the oven.
response_guidance: Do not open the oven door.
learning_goal: Recognize that strange smells can mean danger.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to check the oven safely.

scenario: You see a wire with broken covering near the TV.
response_guidance: Do not touch it or step near it.
learning_goal: Identify damaged wires as dangerous.
trusted_action: Stay away and call an adult to fix it.

scenario: Your cat knocks over a vase and water spreads near an outlet.
response_guidance: Do not try to dry it yourself.
learning_goal: Recognize combined household hazards.
trusted_action: Call an adult immediately.

scenario: You accidentally step on a thumbtack.
response_guidance: Do not pull it out roughly.
learning_goal: Learn safe reactions to small injuries.
trusted_action: Sit down and ask an adult for help.

scenario: You find a lighter on the table.
response_guidance: Do not touch or play with it.
learning_goal: Identify objects that can cause fires.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to store it safely.

scenario: You hear a strange buzzing from a lamp.
response_guidance: Do not touch or unplug it.
learning_goal: Recognize electrical problems as warning signs.
trusted_action: Turn off the switch and tell an adult.

scenario: The kitchen towel catches fire while cooking.
response_guidance: Do not try to touch or blow on it.
learning_goal: React safely during sudden fires.
trusted_action: Alert an adult and move away quickly.

scenario: You see bubbles or foam coming out of the washing machine.
response_guidance: Do not touch the foam or open the door.
learning_goal: Understand machines may malfunction sometimes.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to stop the machine safely.

scenario: You see your pet trying to chew on power cables.
response_guidance: Do not grab the cable or the pet.
learning_goal: Protect pets and yourself from electric shock.
trusted_action: Call an adult to move the pet away safely.

scenario: Your friend visits and wants to explore the attic.
response_guidance: Do not go to unsafe or closed areas alone.
learning_goal: Recognize unsafe areas in the home.
trusted_action: Ask a parent before entering such places.

scenario: You see your younger sibling trying to climb on a chair to reach a high shelf.
response_guidance: Do not let them climb without help.
learning_goal: Understand how climbing furniture can lead to falls.
trusted_action: Call an adult to help instead.

scenario: You notice your dog has knocked over a glass of juice near a power socket.
response_guidance: Do not wipe it yourself.
learning_goal: Learn to recognize danger when liquids and electricity mix.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away.

scenario: You find cleaning sprays under the sink with colorful bottles.
response_guidance: Do not touch or smell them.
learning_goal: Understand cleaning products can be poisonous.
trusted_action: Close the cabinet and tell an adult.

scenario: You want to heat your food in the microwave when no adult is home.
response_guidance: Do not use the microwave alone.
learning_goal: Learn that some appliances need supervision.
trusted_action: Wait for an adult to help.

scenario: You see your sibling putting a metal spoon inside the microwave.
response_guidance: Stop them and alert an adult.
learning_goal: Recognize metal objects are unsafe in microwaves.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately to prevent danger.

scenario: You see a loose step on the staircase.
response_guidance: Do not jump or run near it.
learning_goal: Recognize home hazards and report them.
trusted_action: Tell an adult so they can fix it.

scenario: The bathroom floor is wet after your bath.
response_guidance: Do not run or jump.
learning_goal: Understand wet floors can cause slips.
trusted_action: Ask an adult for a towel to dry it.

scenario: You find an iron plugged in and hot on the table.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move it.
learning_goal: Recognize hot objects can burn skin.
trusted_action: Tell an adult and keep distance.

scenario: You accidentally knock over a cup of tea.
response_guidance: Step back quickly and do not try to clean it right away.
learning_goal: Learn how to prevent and respond to hot spills.
trusted_action: Call an adult for help.

scenario: The fridge door is slightly open, and cold air is escaping.
response_guidance: Close it gently without forcing it.
learning_goal: Learn to use household items properly.
trusted_action: Close it and tell an adult if it won’t shut properly.

scenario: You find a bottle labeled with a skull and crossbones in the cabinet.
response_guidance: Do not open or smell it.
learning_goal: Recognize warning labels on dangerous items.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away.

scenario: You find scissors left open on the table.
response_guidance: Do not touch the blades.
learning_goal: Understand sharp tools can cut skin.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to store them safely.

scenario: You see a bug in your room and want to spray insect killer.
response_guidance: Do not use sprays yourself.
learning_goal: Recognize that insect sprays are toxic.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to handle it.

scenario: You see someone cooking with oil and flames suddenly appear.
response_guidance: Do not throw water or go near it.
learning_goal: Learn to recognize fire hazards in the kitchen.
trusted_action: Alert an adult and move away.

scenario: You find a plastic bag on the floor.
response_guidance: Do not put it over your head or face.
learning_goal: Understand how plastic bags can block breathing.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to throw it away safely.

scenario: There’s a loud noise outside and someone knocks on the door when you are alone at home.
response_guidance: Do not open the door or answer.
learning_goal: Understand that only trusted adults should answer doors.
trusted_action: Call your parent or a trusted adult.

scenario: You find your cat stuck behind the washing machine.
response_guidance: Do not try to pull the machine or reach behind it.
learning_goal: Recognize household risks involving appliances.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to help safely.

scenario: You see a light bulb flickering in your room.
response_guidance: Do not touch or twist it yourself.
learning_goal: Learn to report electrical issues safely.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to check it.

scenario: You find a heater running close to a blanket.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move the heater.
learning_goal: Understand fire risks near heating sources.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to move the blanket away.

scenario: The bathroom light stops working while you are inside.
response_guidance: Do not touch switches or cords.
learning_goal: Learn to stay calm and safe in sudden darkness.
trusted_action: Call for an adult to help.

scenario: You notice water dripping from the ceiling during rain.
response_guidance: Stay away from the leak area.
learning_goal: Understand that water leaks can be dangerous near power sources.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately.

scenario: You see your sibling trying to stick a pencil into a fan.
response_guidance: Stop them and move away.
learning_goal: Learn to recognize moving parts as dangerous.
trusted_action: Call an adult to stop it safely.

scenario: You see a pot boiling over on the stove.
response_guidance: Do not touch or move the pot.
learning_goal: Understand kitchen safety and heat dangers.
trusted_action: Call an adult to turn it off.

scenario: You notice the washing machine making loud banging noises.
response_guidance: Do not open or hit the machine.
learning_goal: Understand how to react safely to appliance malfunctions.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to check it.

scenario: You see your pet chewing on your school cord charger.
response_guidance: Do not pull the cord or touch the pet.
learning_goal: Understand cords and pets are a dangerous mix.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately.

scenario: The carpet corner is folded up near the hallway.
response_guidance: Do not run near it.
learning_goal: Recognize tripping hazards at home.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to fix it properly.

scenario: You find your sibling playing with coins near their mouth.
response_guidance: Do not let them put small things in their mouth.
learning_goal: Recognize choking dangers from small objects.
trusted_action: Take the coins away and tell an adult.

scenario: You see a power strip overloaded with many plugs.
response_guidance: Do not unplug or rearrange anything yourself.
learning_goal: Understand electrical overload can cause fires.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to unplug safely.

scenario: The smoke alarm battery starts beeping softly every few minutes.
response_guidance: Do not climb to fix it.
learning_goal: Recognize alarms need adults to handle safely.
trusted_action: Tell an adult to change the battery.

scenario: You find water coming out of the refrigerator.
response_guidance: Do not touch any wires or step on the puddle.
learning_goal: Recognize appliance leaks as potential hazards.
trusted_action: Tell an adult right away.

scenario: You find your little brother playing with a remote control battery.
response_guidance: Take it away gently and do not let him put it in his mouth.
learning_goal: Understand button batteries are very dangerous if swallowed.
trusted_action: Tell an adult immediately.

scenario: You see steam coming out of a pot while your parent is cooking.
response_guidance: Do not get too close to smell it.
learning_goal: Learn to stay safe around hot steam.
trusted_action: Watch from a safe distance.

scenario: The power goes off, and you want to use candles.
response_guidance: Do not light candles yourself.
learning_goal: Understand fire tools are only for adults.
trusted_action: Wait for an adult to handle candles or flashlights.

scenario: You receive a friend request from someone you don’t know who says they’re a 'friend of a friend'.
response_guidance: Never accept friend requests or messages from people you don’t know in real life. Tell a parent or guardian immediately.
learning_goal: Recognize that online strangers can pretend to be someone else.
trusted_action: Ignore and report the profile; inform an adult.

scenario: You’re home alone after school and someone knocks saying they’re delivering a package for your parents.
response_guidance: Do not open the door. Ask them to leave the package outside and contact your parent or trusted neighbor.
learning_goal: Understand how to stay safe when home alone.
trusted_action: Keep doors locked and communicate only through closed doors.

scenario: Your friend asks for your Wi-Fi password to download games when they visit.
response_guidance: Only share Wi-Fi or passwords with your parents’ permission.
learning_goal: Understand that family network information is private and secure.
trusted_action: Ask a parent before sharing any private details.

scenario: You notice a strong gas smell coming from the kitchen.
response_guidance: Do not turn on any lights or appliances. Leave the house immediately and call for help from a neighbor or safe spot.
learning_goal: Identify the smell of gas and know emergency steps.
trusted_action: Evacuate and contact an adult or emergency services.

scenario: You accidentally overflow the sink while washing dishes.
response_guidance: Turn off the tap, unplug nearby devices, and dry the area safely using a mop or towel.
learning_goal: Respond calmly to small water-related incidents.
trusted_action: Clean safely and tell an adult about the accident.

scenario: A website asks for your name, age, and school before you can play a game.
response_guidance: Never enter personal details online without a parent’s permission.
learning_goal: Protect personal information on digital platforms.
trusted_action: Show the website to your parent before using it.

scenario: You accidentally break a glass while home alone.
response_guidance: Carefully sweep or vacuum the area using tools, not hands, and tell your parent when they return.
learning_goal: Handle small accidents safely and responsibly.
trusted_action: Clean safely and communicate honestly.

scenario: You overhear your parents’ private conversation and your friend asks what they said.
response_guidance: Explain kindly that private conversations aren’t yours to share.
learning_goal: Develop respect for boundaries and privacy.
trusted_action: Keep family discussions private.

scenario: A friend dares you to post a funny video of your sibling without their permission.
response_guidance: Never post photos or videos of others without asking them first.
learning_goal: Understand digital respect and consent.
trusted_action: Get consent or choose not to share.

scenario: Your tablet starts to overheat while charging.
response_guidance: Unplug it carefully and tell an adult. Never place devices under pillows or blankets.
learning_goal: Recognize electrical overheating hazards.
trusted_action: Disconnect safely and report issues.

scenario: You feel scared when the power goes out while home alone.
response_guidance: Stay calm, find a flashlight, and call your parent or guardian for reassurance.
learning_goal: Build calm responses to unexpected events.
trusted_action: Use coping strategies and communication.

scenario: You’re invited to join a private chat group by classmates who share funny memes.
response_guidance: Join only if it’s school-related and approved by your parents. Leave if people start sharing mean or inappropriate content.
learning_goal: Recognize peer pressure and manage digital boundaries.
trusted_action: Set limits and ask for adult help if needed.

scenario: A friend asks for your parent’s phone number to prank call them.
response_guidance: Politely refuse and explain that phone numbers are private.
learning_goal: Develop respect for personal data and boundaries.
trusted_action: Keep contact info private.

scenario: You smell burning plastic in another room.
response_guidance: Check only from a safe distance, alert an adult, and prepare to leave the house if smoke increases.
learning_goal: Identify early fire risks.
trusted_action: Prioritize safety over curiosity.

scenario: You spill water near your computer.
response_guidance: Turn off the power from the switch and unplug devices safely using dry hands.
learning_goal: Prevent electric shock during accidents.
trusted_action: Dry the area and call an adult.

scenario: A pop-up ad says you won a free phone if you click a link.
response_guidance: Never click suspicious links or share personal info. Tell an adult immediately.
learning_goal: Recognize online scams and avoid risky links.
trusted_action: Close the tab and report it to a parent.

scenario: You hear strange noises outside at night while alone.
response_guidance: Stay inside, keep doors locked, and call your parent or trusted neighbor.
learning_goal: Manage fear and react safely when alone.
trusted_action: Avoid investigating alone; call for help.

scenario: You’re tempted to post your home address for an online giveaway.
response_guidance: Never post personal addresses, school names, or phone numbers online.
learning_goal: Protect identity and location details.
trusted_action: Check with a parent before joining online contests.

scenario: You accidentally leave a towel near the stove and it catches fire.
response_guidance: Don’t try to touch it. Shout for help, move away, and call emergency services.
learning_goal: Respond safely to sudden fires.
trusted_action: Call adults or emergency services immediately.

scenario: You want to reheat food in the microwave using a metal bowl.
response_guidance: Never use metal in microwaves. Ask an adult before heating food.
learning_goal: Understand appliance rules to prevent damage or fire.
trusted_action: Use only microwave-safe containers.

scenario: A friend asks for your gaming password so they can log in as you.
response_guidance: Never share passwords, even with friends. It keeps your account safe.
learning_goal: Value digital privacy and boundaries.
trusted_action: Keep passwords private and strong.

scenario: You accidentally lock yourself out of the house.
response_guidance: Go to a trusted neighbor or call your parent; never try to climb in through windows.
learning_goal: Stay calm and find safe help when locked out.
trusted_action: Contact an adult instead of forcing entry.

scenario: Your sibling forgets to log out of their social account on the family computer.
response_guidance: Log them out and don’t look at their messages.
learning_goal: Respect others’ online privacy.
trusted_action: Be honest and protect family privacy.

scenario: You notice a plug sparking when you connect it.
response_guidance: Unplug immediately, move away, and inform an adult.
learning_goal: Recognize unsafe electrical equipment.
trusted_action: Avoid using damaged plugs or wires.

scenario: Someone comments rudely on your photo.
response_guidance: Don’t reply. Screenshot and show a trusted adult.
learning_goal: Handle online negativity calmly and safely.
trusted_action: Report or block harmful users.

scenario: You try to use the stove without supervision.
response_guidance: Never use stoves or sharp tools without an adult present.
learning_goal: Understand cooking-related hazards.
trusted_action: Ask an adult to assist before cooking.

scenario: A player in your game asks what city you live in.
response_guidance: Never share personal details during games.
learning_goal: Stay safe while gaming online.

scenario: You find old family documents with personal details.
response_guidance: Do not share or throw them away. Tell your parents where you found them.
learning_goal: Handle sensitive documents properly.
trusted_action: Report personal info found at home to an adult.

scenario: You see your phone charger cable is torn but still working.
response_guidance: Stop using it and ask for a new one. Torn cables can cause shocks or fire.
learning_goal: Identify damaged electronics.
trusted_action: Unplug safely and inform an adult.

scenario: You feel hungry while alone and want to cook noodles.
response_guidance: Use only safe appliances like a microwave, not the stove, unless an adult says it’s okay.
learning_goal: Make safe choices about food preparation.

scenario: You light a candle for a project and forget to blow it out.
response_guidance: Always blow out candles before leaving the room.
learning_goal: Understand candle and flame safety.
trusted_action: Never leave flames unattended.

scenario: You’ve been playing games for hours and forgot to finish homework.
response_guidance: Take regular breaks and set screen limits with parents’ help.
learning_goal: Develop balance between screen time and responsibilities.
trusted_action: Use reminders or timers for healthy routines.

scenario: You receive a package addressed to your parents when they’re not home.
response_guidance: Do not open packages or sign for them. Wait until your parents return.

scenario: You’re excited about a family trip and want to post about it online.
response_guidance: Never share current locations or travel plans online.

trusted_action: Post photos only after returning home.

scenario: You find a website that asks you to upload your picture to 'see your future self'.
response_guidance: Don’t upload photos to unknown websites. Show it to a parent first.
learning_goal: Recognize hidden data collection risks online.

scenario: You run out of milk and think about going to the nearby shop alone.

scenario: You notice smoke coming from a toaster while it’s on.
response_guidance: Turn off the power switch if it’s safe, move away, and alert an adult.

trusted_action: Call for help and never use water on electrical fires.

scenario: Someone online asks you to keep your chat a 'secret'.
response_guidance: Secrets online are unsafe. Tell a trusted adult right away.

scenario: You cut your finger slightly while using scissors.

scenario: You find a link that says 'Watch this funny video' from an unknown email.

scenario: You start feeling lonely while staying home alone.

scenario: You want to share a funny meme that includes your friend’s face without asking.

scenario: You see your sibling using wet hands to plug a charger.

scenario: You open a parent’s drawer looking for a charger without asking.

scenario: You have been using your tablet for over two hours without a break.

scenario: Someone knocks and says they are delivering a package for your parents.

scenario: You want to share a family photo online without asking first.
response_guidance: Always ask permission before posting family pictures.

scenario: Your parent’s phone is not reachable, and there’s a sudden power outage.

scenario: You smell something like rotten eggs in the kitchen.

scenario: You see someone being insulted in a group chat you’re part of.

scenario: You find some pills on the floor that fell from a medicine box.

scenario: You want to reheat pizza in the oven for lunch.

scenario: You notice your charger cable is torn but still works.

scenario: You plan to use the washing machine without instructions.

scenario: Your tablet shows a warning that says your device is 'infected'.

scenario: You notice a toy battery leaking white powder.

scenario: You smell something like rotten eggs in the kitchen.

topic: Classmate Pressures You to Do Something Wrong
scenario: Someone dares you to break a rule or take something without permission.
response_guidance: Say 'No' firmly and tell a teacher immediately.
learning_goal: Teach children to refuse unsafe peer pressure.
trusted_action: Go to a trusted adult for support.

scenario: You are alone in the restroom and feel someone watching.
response_guidance: Leave immediately and tell a teacher.
learning_goal: Teach children to report unsafe situations in private areas.
trusted_action: Find a teacher immediately.

scenario: Someone pushes your chair intentionally in class.
response_guidance: Tell your teacher and move to a safe seat.
learning_goal: Teach children to report unsafe physical interactions.
trusted_action: Go to a trusted adult immediately.

scenario: Someone takes your lunch money without asking.
response_guidance: Tell a teacher or cafeteria supervisor immediately.
learning_goal: Teach children to report theft to trusted adults.
trusted_action: Seek adult assistance immediately.

scenario: You reach over a boiling pot to grab something on the counter.
response_guidance: Step back and use a safe distance from hot surfaces.
learning_goal: Prevent burns while cooking.
trusted_action: Supervise stove use and keep handles turned inward.

scenario: You leave chargers and cords tangled on the floor.
response_guidance: Keep cords organized and away from walkways.
learning_goal: Prevent trips and electrical accidents.
trusted_action: Use cord organizers and check for damage.

scenario: You pour oil into a pan without supervision.
response_guidance: Ask an adult for help and stand back from hot oil.
learning_goal: Prevent burns and kitchen fires.
trusted_action: Always supervise frying or hot oil use.

scenario: You find matches in a drawer and try to light one.
response_guidance: Do not play with matches. Inform an adult immediately.
learning_goal: Prevent accidental fires.
trusted_action: Store matches safely and out of children’s reach.

scenario: You leave an iron face down on the ironing board.
response_guidance: Always place iron upright on a heat-resistant surface.
learning_goal: Prevent burns and fires.
trusted_action: Supervise children when ironing.

scenario: You fill the kettle above the max line.
response_guidance: Do not overfill. Follow appliance instructions.
learning_goal: Prevent burns or electrical hazards.
trusted_action: Supervise children using appliances with boiling water.

scenario: You put sharp knives in the dishwasher without care.
response_guidance: Place sharp objects with points down and separate from other items.
learning_goal: Prevent cuts and injuries in the kitchen.
trusted_action: Supervise loading of sharp objects.

scenario: A player asks you to share your real name and home address.
response_guidance: Do not share personal information online.
learning_goal: Protect privacy and avoid online risks.
trusted_action: Report and block suspicious users.

scenario: You carry a tray of glasses while running.
response_guidance: Walk carefully and carry one glass at a time if needed.
learning_goal: Prevent cuts and injuries from glass.
trusted_action: Supervise children when handling fragile items.

scenario: You plug in too many appliances into a single outlet.
response_guidance: Do not overload outlets; use properly rated extension cords.
learning_goal: Prevent electrical fires and hazards.
trusted_action: Check cords and plugs before use.

topic: Safe Use of Hot Water Tap
scenario: You turn on the hot water tap without checking temperature.
response_guidance: Check water temperature before using.
learning_goal: Prevent scalding burns from hot water.
trusted_action: Supervise children using hot water.

scenario: Someone unknown tries to enter the home while you are alone.
response_guidance: Do not open the door. Go to a safe room and call an adult.
learning_goal: React safely to strangers when home alone.
trusted_action: Follow home-alone safety plan and alert authorities if necessary.

scenario: You see medicines left on a counter within reach of younger siblings.
response_guidance: Do not touch. Inform an adult immediately.
learning_goal: Prevent accidental ingestion of medicines.
trusted_action: Store medicines securely out of reach.

scenario: A classmate repeatedly calls you a mean name in class.
response_guidance: Tell your teacher or school counselor. It’s not okay to be called names.
learning_goal: Teach children to report verbal bullying.
trusted_action: Talk to a trusted adult when verbal bullying occurs.

scenario: Someone keeps pushing you while waiting in line.
response_guidance: Say 'Stop!' and tell a teacher immediately.
learning_goal: Teach children to report unsafe physical behavior.
trusted_action: Go to a trusted adult for help.

scenario: A classmate laughs at your clothes and makes fun of you.
response_guidance: Tell your teacher or school counselor. It’s not okay to be teased.
learning_goal: Teach children to report emotional bullying.
trusted_action: Seek guidance from a trusted adult.

scenario: A classmate keeps standing too close despite being told to step back.
response_guidance: Say 'Please step back' and tell a teacher if it continues.
learning_goal: Teach children to assert personal boundaries safely.
trusted_action: Report persistent invasion to a trusted adult.

topic: Classmate Dares You to Break Rules
scenario: Someone dares you to cheat or take something from another student.
response_guidance: Say 'No' and tell your teacher immediately.
learning_goal: Teach children to refuse unsafe peer pressure.
trusted_action: Report peer pressure to a trusted adult.

trusted_action: Seek a trusted adult if someone mocks you repeatedly.

learning_goal: Teach children to handle small conflicts and involve adults if needed.
trusted_action: Seek teacher support if sharing doesn’t work.
